projects.name: Time Inc - Time For Kids Classroom App

images.name: 1_coastal
images.text: Forgot Password Email (desktop version)

images.name: 2_coastal_mobile
images.text: Forgot Password Email (mobile version)

images.name: 1_pe_storefront
images.text: Custom webview storefront. Separate code from iPad storefront. Latest issue in hero position along with back issues available in vertical scroll.

images.name: 2_pe_issue
images.text: Details about the issue when tapping the issue cover from the storefront.

images.name: 3_pe_library
images.text: Library consisting of entitled issues purchased through the storefront, activated via print subscription, or entitled by other (online digital subscription without iTunes) means through login credentials.

images.name: 1_time_library
images.text: Library consisting of issues to be purchased, downloaded, and viewed. The top horizontal section is a web viewer used for cross-selling to other brands and apps as well as advertising subscriptions, free samples, and special offers.

images.name: 2_people_storefront
images.text: The storefront for People is unique in that it is the only brand using this design. The storefront lists the most current issue along with recent back issues to be purchased and downloaded.

images.name: 3_people_regform
images.text: This is a registration form used to create a digital account. A digital account allows you to sign-in to different apps (iPad / Kindle Fire) to access purchased issues and subscriptions.

images.name: 4_people_myaccount
images.text: The my account section allows the user to navigation through account management from 'forgot password' to 'terms of service' and 'privacy policies'.

images.name: 5_ew_storefront
images.text: Similar to the People storefront, this is the shared designed across other Time Inc brands on iPad.

images.name: 6_si_storefront
images.text: Similar to the People storefront, this is the shared designed across other Time Inc brands on iPad.

images.name: 7_si_preview
images.text: Tapping a cover within the store that has not been downloaded, will open this preview. The preview provides a small example of what can be found within the issue, along with the option to purchase or download the issue.

images.name: 8_amex_welcome
images.text: First screen displayed. UX design helps user identify where to begin (subscribe digtally, browse issues, or access if you are a print subscriber).

images.name: 9_amex_storefront
images.text: Unique to the traditional Time Inc storefronts, this is a new look to experiment what encourages users to browse, subscribe or buy single copies.

images.name: 10_amex_issue
images.text: Screenshot with a swipable UX to allow users to see what they are buying, before they commit to a purchase.

images.name: 1_si_lookback
images.text: SI Lookback (SI Vault) standalone jQuery page. - visit at http://subscription-assets.timeinc.com/prod/assets/themes/magazines/SUBS/templates/velocity/site/si-lookback1113/si-lookback.html

images.name: 2_ew_webapp
images.text: Entertainment Weekly - Adobe DPS Web Application. - visit at https://subscription.ew.com/storefront/site/ew-digitalmagazine/login.html

images.name: 3_amazon_astore
images.text: Amazon Affiliate Store - iFrame pulled into Time Inc hosted landing page. - visit at http://subscription-assets.timeinc.com/prod/assets/themes/magazines/SUBS/templates/velocity/site/amz-timebooks1114/lp.html

images.name: 4_tfk_contentviewer
images.text: Sample Web Reader (images/video) to replace Adobe Flash reader for cross-browser support (iPad included). - visit at http://goo.gl/NdMa4A

projects.name: New York Post - iPad Ad Counts

images.name: 1_home
images.text: Used by Ad Operations, this tool allows users to setup ad placements for different issues within the iPad app.

images.name: 2_select_issue
images.text: A dropdown list makes it easy for Ad Operations to find the issue they need to work in, or if they need to refer to a past 'archived' issue.

images.name: 3_issue_start
images.text: Selecting the current or a future issue allows Ad Operations to start setting up new ads.

images.name: 4_click_save_and_see_json-1
images.text: After creating ads, clicking 'Save' will allow you to see the JSON object (as a string).

images.name: 5_click_save_and_see_json-2
images.text: Here is a JSON object (as a string) that one could use for troubleshooting if there are any problems in the database.

images.name: 6_pull_saved_ad_info
images.text: Here is an inspection on an XHR to pull in an archived issue, producing one large JSON object with more details.

images.name: 1_newsletter

feed.title: Newsletter JSON Feed (6/7/12)
feed.description: Daily Newsletter is setup as handsfree automation populating content from this feed.

images.name: signup
images.text: Signup Page - Users may subscribe to receive New York Post emails. http://nypost.com/newsletter

images.name: emailpref
images.text: Email Preferences - Subscribers may modify what email they receive.

images.name: move_legacy
images.text: User Management - Users in the legacy system must use this API to move from legacy into the new list accepting a new privacy policy. This allows the New York Post to control lists more efficiently.

images.name: email_signup_widget
images.text: Email Signup Widget - API connection to SailThru, signs up to multiple lists, assigns multiple variables per user and sends a welcome email.
